award_title: REU Site: Exploring the FABRIC Research Instrument to Catalyze Multi-disciplinary Research in Networks, Distributed Systems, and Emerging CyberInfrastructure (CI) Applications
subject: Reference credit vs. actual reuse
body:
Hi Anirban,

You're training students to build networked systems and tools on FABRICâ€”real computational work that should outlive the paper.

Problem is, even when code gets cited, it's usually not actually reused. It ends up as a zip file somewhere, not something other researchers can build on.

Ouro helps researchers package and share computational tools so they're genuinely usable long-term, not just referenced. Makes the work both citable and measurably used.

Worth a quick chat? Happy to keep it short.

Hope your holidays are going well.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
